## Aim
- To investigate **trends** in the **incidence rate** & **main indication** for rKA over past 15 years in UK

## Methods {.smaller}

::: columns
::: {.column width="45%"}

  - Effect of Covid-19: 2020 v 2019

# Results {background-color="#0F1D41"}

## Increases in rate of rKA have slowed

:::{r-stack}
![](files/images/Fig 1b.png){height="500" fig-align="center"}
:::

## Covid-19 pandemic {.smaller}

-   **43.6% reduction** in rKA in 2020 compared to 2019

:::{r-stack}
![](files/images/Fig 1b.png){height="500" fig-align="center"}
:::

## Most rKA now linkable to a pKA

-   4.4% in 2006, 71.3% in 2019

## Limitations
- Trends in reporting or practice?
- Inadequate data to calculate prevalence
- Reason for revision:
  - Diagnosis hierarchy
  - Change in coding over study period

# Conclusion

-   *Slowing* of increases in rKA over past 15 years
-   Infection &uarr; &uarr;
    - Prevalent in re-revision
-   Aseptic loosening &darr;
